headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, Deprecation, Sunset
headers.vary: Accept, Authorization, Cookie, X-GitHub-OTP, Accept-Encoding, Accept, X-Requested-With
headers.x-github-media-type: github.squirrel-girl-preview; format=json, github.inertia-preview; format=json, github.starfox-preview; format=json, github.mockingbird-preview; param=sailor-v-preview; format=json, github.squirrel-girl-preview; format=json, github.inertia-preview; format=json, github.starfox-preview; format=json, github.mockingbird-preview; param=sailor-v-preview; format=json

data.title: Add log stream to deployment
data.body:
Related to https://github.com/Azure/webapps-deploy/issues/119

Currently, when using this GitHub Action, no real-time deployment logs are shown, so it looks like the action is hanging. You won't see anything except for `Package deployment using ZIP Deploy initiated.` until the very end, where a link to the log files is shown:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17739158/113000986-a2e1be00-9170-11eb-9803-fce66f491b32.png)

When using [Azure's VS Code extension](https://docs.microsoft.com/nl-nl/azure/developer/javascript/tutorial/deploy-nodejs-azure-app-service-with-visual-studio-code?tabs=bash) to do a deployment, a real-time log stream is shown, so that you know exactly what the Azure service is currently doing. Could this please be added to this GH Action as well?

data.title: Add docs for efficiently deploying Node.js Express apps
data.body:
I have a Node.js Express app (NestJS) which needs the whole `node_modules` folder to be present when running it. When using this GitHub Action is correctly builds the ZIP, but the simply fails after 20-30 mins (can't remember how long exactly it took). There are ~60000 files in the folder (`node_modules` is always huge), so I guess there's just too many files and folders for this to work well.

```
1:58:39 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 23346 files...
1:58:59 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 24335 files...
1:59:19 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 25339 files...
1:59:39 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 26327 files...
1:59:59 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 27136 files...
2:00:19 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 27718 files...
2:00:40 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 28363 files...
2:01:00 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 29270 files...
2:01:20 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 30209 files...
2:01:40 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 30977 files...
2:02:00 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 31585 files...
2:02:20 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 32213 files...
2:02:41 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 32797 files...
2:03:01 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 33157 files...
2:03:21 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 33609 files...
2:03:41 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 34249 files...
2:04:01 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 34861 files...
2:04:21 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 35218 files...
2:04:41 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 35655 files...
2:05:01 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 36304 files...
2:05:21 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 36867 files...
2:05:41 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 37410 files...
2:06:01 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 38014 files...
2:06:21 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 38862 files...
2:06:41 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 39533 files...
2:07:01 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Processed 40256 files...
2:07:02 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: An unknown error has occurred. Check the diagnostic log for details.
2:07:04 PM REDACTED-app-backend-dev: Deployment failed.
```

In this case it's much more efficient to simply build the package on the Azure side, rather than using GitHub Actions for that. According to the docs at https://docs.microsoft.com/nl-nl/azure/developer/javascript/tutorial/deploy-nodejs-azure-app-service-with-visual-studio-code, you can simply set `SCM_DO_BUILD_DURING_DEPLOYMENT=1` and `WEBSITE_NODE_DEFAULT_VERSION` in the app settings. Then it will build on the Azure side.

Could you please update the docs to add some info on the `SCM_DO_BUILD_DURING_DEPLOYMENT=1` option? With this setting, my workflow is also greatly simplified:

```YAML
# Docs for the Azure Web Apps Deploy action: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2134798
# More GitHub Actions for Azure: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2135048

name: Deploy dev backend

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  build-and-deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    # checkout the repo
    - name: 'Checkout Github Action'
      uses: actions/checkout@master

    - name: Run Azure webapp deploy action using publish profile credentials
      uses: azure/webapps-deploy@v2
      with:
        app-name: REDACTED
        slot-name: Production
        publish-profile: REDACTED
        package: backend
```

data.title: Install private repository during deploy
data.body:
Is there any way to install a private repository during deploy? I've been trying to solve this for quite a while now, even posted on Azure Q&A without any progress.

All steps run fine untill the last step `Deploy to App Service` using `webapps-deploy@v2`. 

This is the YAML I use:

```yaml
name: Build and deploy Sampling App

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

env:
  AZURE_WEBAPP_NAME: 'sampling'
  RESOURCE_GROUP: 'zypp-general'
  PYTHON_VERSION: '3.8' # supports 3.6, 3.7, 3.8)

jobs:
  build-and-test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v2

    - name: Setup Python ${{ env.PYTHON_VERSION }} Environment
      uses: actions/setup-python@v2
      with:
        python-version: ${{ env.PYTHON_VERSION }}

    - name: Create and start virtual environment
      run: |
        python3 -m venv venv
        source venv/bin/activate
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: |
        python -m pip install --upgrade pip
        git config --global url."https://${{ secrets.ACCESS_TOKEN }}@github".insteadOf https://github
        pip install -r requirements.txt

    - name: Upload artifact for deployment jobs
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v2
      with:
        name: python-app
        path: |
          .
          !venv/

  deploy-to-webapp:
    needs: build-and-test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - uses: actions/download-artifact@v2
        with:
          name: python-app
          path: .

      - name: Log in to Azure CLI
        uses: azure/login@v1
        with:
          creds: ${{ secrets.AZURE_SERVICE_PRINCIPAL }}

      - name: Configure deployment and runtime settings on the webapp
        run: |
          az configure --defaults group=${{ env.RESOURCE_GROUP }}
          az webapp config appsettings set --name ${{ env.AZURE_WEBAPP_NAME }} --settings \
              SCM_DO_BUILD_DURING_DEPLOYMENT=true \
              FLASK_ENV=production
          az webapp config set --name ${{ env.AZURE_WEBAPP_NAME }} \
            --startup-file "gunicorn --bind=0.0.0.0 --timeout 600 app:app"
      - name: Deploy to App Service
        uses: azure/webapps-deploy@v2
        with:
          app-name: ${{ env.AZURE_WEBAPP_NAME}}
```

Here is the full error:

```
  with:
    app-name: sampling
    slot-name: productio
    package: .
  env:
    AZURE_WEBAPP_NAME: sampling
    RESOURCE_GROUP: zypp-general
    PYTHON_VERSION: 3.8
    AZURE_HTTP_USER_AGENT: 
    AZUREPS_HOST_ENVIRONMENT: 
Package deployment using ZIP Deploy initiated.
Updating submodules.

Repository path is /tmp/zipdeploy/extracted

Build Operation ID: |ofjAZ2HG4ig=.9061ce80_
Repository Commit : 2bde9d73-ef49-47bb-8d61-cda25d352ad5

WARNING: You are using pip version 20.2.1; however, version 21.0.1 is available.
You should consider upgrading via the '/tmp/8d8e7b6e3a9d712/antenv/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade pip' command.
ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 128: git clone -q https://github.com/zypp-io/steekproef.git /tmp/pip-install-vpcuydir/steekproef Check the logs for full command output.\nWARNING: You are using pip version 20.2.1; however, version 21.0.1 is available.\nYou should consider upgrading via the '/tmp/8d8e7b6e3a9d712/antenv/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade pip' command.\n/opt/Kudu/Scripts/starter.sh oryx build /tmp/zipdeploy/extracted -o /home/site/wwwroot --platform python --platform-version 3.8 -i /tmp/8d8e7b6e3a9d712 -p compress_virtualenv=tar-gz -p virtualenv_name=antenv --log-file /tmp/build-debug.log 
Error: Failed to deploy web package to App Service.
Error: Deployment Failed with Error: Package deployment using ZIP Deploy failed. Refer logs for more details.
App Service Application URL: http://sampling.azurewebsites.net
```

And our `requirements.txt`:

```
email-validator>=1.1.2
Flask>=1.1.2
Flask-Bcrypt>=0.7.1
Flask-Bootstrap>=3.3.7.1
Flask-Dropzone
Flask-Cors>=3.0.10
Flask-Login>=0.5.0
Flask-Mail>=0.9.1
Flask-SQLAlchemy>=2.4.4
Flask-WTF>=0.14.3
itsdangerous>=1.1.0
openpyxl>=3.0.6
pandas>=1.2.1
python-dotenv>=0.15.0
pyodbc>=4.0.30
xlsxwriter>=1.3.7
xlrd>=2.0.
git+https://github.com/zypp-io/steekproef.git#egg=steekproef
```

The error makes sense since it is a private repo and we solve this above in step "Install dependencies" with:
```
git config --global url."https://${{ secrets.ACCESS_TOKEN }}@github".insteadOf https://github
```
